content.body: There be only two sacraments ordained by Christ our Lord in the Gospel; that is to say, baptism, and the Supper of the Lord: neither of which may be dispensed by any, but by a minister of the Word lawfully ordained.
content.name: Confession of Faith
content.title: Chapter 27: Of the Sacraments

content_with_prooftexts.body: There be only two sacraments ordained by Christ our Lord in the Gospel; that is to say, baptism, and the Supper of the Lord: neither of which may be dispensed by any, but by a minister of the Word lawfully ordained.1
content_with_prooftexts.name: Confession of Faith

prooftexts.1:
Matthew 28:19

Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

1 Corinthians 11:20

When you come together, it is not the Lord's supper that you eat.

1 Corinthians 11:23

For I received from the Lord what I also delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus on the night when he was betrayed took bread,

1 Corinthians 4:1

4:1 This is how one should regard us, as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.

Hebrews 5:4

And no one takes this honor for himself, but only when called by God, just as Aaron was. (ESV)

content_with_prooftexts.title: Chapter 27: Of the Sacraments

feed:
Confession of Faith
Chapter 27: Of the Sacraments

4. There be only two sacraments ordained by Christ our Lord in the Gospel; that is to say, baptism, and the Supper of the Lord: neither of which may be dispensed by any, but by a minister of the Word lawfully ordained.1

  1. Matthew 28:19

    Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

    1 Corinthians 11:20

    When you come together, it is not the Lord's supper that you eat.

    1 Corinthians 11:23

    For I received from the Lord what I also delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus on the night when he was betrayed took bread,

    1 Corinthians 4:1

    4:1 This is how one should regard us, as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.

    Hebrews 5:4

    And no one takes this honor for himself, but only when called by God, just as Aaron was. (ESV)
title: Of the sacraments, part 4
